Dialog.Content: ...She should be back by now.
Just relax, Linus! You've been pacing for an hour now. She'll be back soon enough; I mean, this is Jo we're talking about. She could take on a whole army if she wanted to.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: I'm worried about us, Shei! She's our lifeline in this city. If something happens to her or they find us while she's away...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Then we'll deal with it when it happens won't we? We've made it this far, and you're getting closer to figuring out how to use that weird sword-
<knock knock knock>

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...that wasn't the knock we agreed on...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...maybe she forgot?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: That's not a risk I'm willing to take. Ugh, I can't believe we chose to hide out in an apartment with no back exits! We're going to have to fight past them.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Why don't we check the peephole first?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: No, they'll be able to tell someone's looking through it and then kick the door into us. Here's the plan: I'll throw it open and you spear anyone who isn't Jo.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...Okay, I'm ready. On three?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Yeah. One... Two...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: THREE!
AAAAAAHHH!!!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Haha! Woah there! Glad to see you're both on your toes!

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: That wasn't the password we agreed on.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hm? Password? Ohhh yes yes, sorry it slipped my mind. I was very focused preoccupied with losing my tail.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Perhaps you'll forgive me in exchange for... pizza??

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...What toppings?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Bacon, sausage, and pepperoni of course. Just because I forgot about the secret code doesn't mean I don't remember you're an insatiable carnivore.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Hm... Forgiven.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Mhm, you're off the hook. This time.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Have you made any progress with that strange sword artifact of yours, Linus?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Nof reahy, ah feeh hike-

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Finish chewing first.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: No, hardly any. I feel like I've hit a plateau on what I can discern with the knowledge available.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: The researchers called it the "Nymane Key". There's some deep power hidden away in it, but I've only managed to scratch the surface.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: The people they've been sending after you two are certainly an indication of that. The ones who assaulted our previous hideout were a Grade 2 office.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Ugh... I wish they'd just leave us alone...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: These runic arrays all contain different functions. I've found these six here can work in conjunction to project a shield, for example.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: But a lot of these runes are worn down, damaged; I believe they might still work but only with an immense amount of power supplied into them.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Does it need to be hooked up to a generator then?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Not electrical power. The Key seems to run on... well, I'm not entirely sure. All I know is if I could unlock its true potential... it would be able to manipulate the fabric of reality itself.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: No wonder they want it back so bad...

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: All the more reason to make sure no one else gets their hands on it.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Uh, Linus, by the way, earlier I got something that I think might help you figure out more about the Key.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: You've heard of the Library right?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...the library?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Hahah, one track mind as always. It became a Star of the City lately, everyone's been talking about it.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...I have more important things to focus on...

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: May I see that?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hm...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: If there's anywhere that will have info to help him figure that sword out it's here right?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Wait... is this the one that no one ever returns from? I remember hearing something about the Thumb.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Well... yeah, when you put it that way it sounds pretty dangerous.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Indeed, there's no way either of you will be setting foot in that place. This may be worth looking into though.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Eh? Are you saying you'll go alone?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hm? Of course. You two are safest here and we need every lead we can get.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: No way, not this time! This is a Star of the City we're talking about. We're strong now too, so if you're going then so are we! Right Linus?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: I'd rather none of us go. It sounds needlessly risky.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: *sigh* I hate to say it but it's only a matter of time until we get found by someone we can't outrun or beat in a fight. Everything depends on that "Nymane Key" of yours. It's, well, the key to the two of you's survival.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: And I'll be damned if I let anything happen to either of you.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: But...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: But we're not going to let anything happen to you either, Jo! All the close calls we've gotten out of we got out of as a team; if we're not watching eachother's backs then no one is.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Yeah, either we all go or none of us do.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Haha, always so stubborn...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: What's wrong?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: We have company. Grab your weapons.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Dammit, already?! I knew we should've hid somewhere with a back exit!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Unfortunately we're running out of good places to hide. We'll have to fight our way out this time.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Not necessarily, if we sign this invitation apparently it'll teleport us out of here! We might even be able to just hide there for a bit without going through the "ordeal" it talks about.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Not a bad idea. Here, give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Are you certain? I have a bad feeling about this.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes, now both of you sign it. We're out of time.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Shit!

Dialog.Title: Hunter
Dialog.Content: There they are! Open fire!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ah, they brought guns this time.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Linus, your turn! Hurry!

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Dammit...

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ahaha! Come on then! Face me in melee!

Dialog.Title: Hunter
Dialog.Content: Shit! Her armor's bullet proof!

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Let's hope this Library has some useful info.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Huh, I remember seeing the open bounty on those three before coming here. That was no small sum. I even considered going after them myself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They look like small fry, but if they've survived this long and are even willing to take on a Star of the City by themselves, then maybe there's more to them than meets the eye.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It's bizarre seeing someone wearing full platemail in the City though, and what's up with that girl's feather shawl thing? They look more like LARPers than fugitives.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: 'LARPers'?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh, it's nothing ma'am.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I'm interested in that 'Nymane Key'. After you've received our guests: those who were trying to retrieve it will no doubt come here looking for the book containing it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I wonder what that thing is though? Other than a very impractical looking rusty sword. It looks like something that'd come from the Ruins.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Acquire their books and perhaps that mystery will be unraveled.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, yeah, I got it.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Everyone alright?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Jeez that was a close call. Linus?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Ugh... dangit.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Linus? What's wrong?

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Forgot to grab the pizza...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Linus.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Don't look at me like that, Shei! You know how I feel about wasted food.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Right. Sorry. Just remind yourself you're not in the Outskirts anymore okay? Food is abundant here.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hahaha, I'll be sure to treat us all to a proper feast after this is over.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role's namesake.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hello! I am Johanna Seraphine, once a Grade 1 Fixer and now the steadfast guardian of these two.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Uh, hi! I'm Sheire! Nice to meet you.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: ...Linus.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: C'mon Linus, be polite.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Sorry, it just feels weird to be cordial with someone who's probably hoping we'll die here...

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Right, uh, speaking of: I don't suppose we could just... wait here for a bit until the people chasing us give up, and then leave peacefully?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The rules of the invitation are clear: you must either overcome the ordeal before you, or be converted into books yourselves.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Turned into a book? That's unsettling.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: It was worth an attempt young Sheire, but it seems the only option is to press forward.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: *sigh* Why does it always end in violence...?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Hey wait-! Oh, there she goes.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Fixer
Dialog.Content: Well then. Stay behind me, and if things start to look bad we retreat.

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: We've got your back, Jo!

Dialog.Title: Fugitive
Dialog.Content: Yeah, let's do this.
